wblut.external.straightskeleton

Class Point3d

  • java.lang.Object
    • wblut.external.straightskeleton.Tuple3d
      • wblut.external.straightskeleton.Point3d
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Corner, LineOnPlane, OOB

    public class Point3d
extends Tuple3d
implements java.io.Serializable
    Part of campskeleton: http://code.google.com/p/campskeleton/ Original Copyright Notice: http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 A 3 element point that is represented by double precision floating point x,y,z coordinates.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructs and initializes a Point3d to (0,0,0).

      Constructs and initializes a Point3d from the array of length 3.

      Constructs and initializes a Point3d from the specified xyz coordinates.
      Point3d(Point3d p1)
      Constructs and initializes a Point3d from the specified Point3d.
      Point3d(Tuple3d t1)
      Constructs and initializes a Point3d from the specified Tuple3d.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns the distance between this point and point p1.

      Computes the L-1 (Manhattan) distance between this point and point p1.

      Computes the L-infinite distance between this point and point p1.

    • Method Detail

      • distanceSquared

        public final double distanceSquared(Point3d p1)
        Returns the square of the distance between this point and point p1.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the square of the distance

      • distance

        public final double distance(Point3d p1)
        Returns the distance between this point and point p1.
        Parameters:
        p1 - the other point
        Returns:
        the distance

      • distanceL1

        public final double distanceL1(Point3d p1)
        Computes the L-1 (Manhattan) distance between this point and point p1. The L-1 distance is equal to: abs(x1-x2) + abs(y1-y2) + abs(z1-z2).
        Parameters:
        p1 - the other point
        Returns:
        the L-1 distance

      • distanceLinf

        public final double distanceLinf(Point3d p1)
        Computes the L-infinite distance between this point and point p1. The L-infinite distance is equal to MAX[abs(x1-x2), abs(y1-y2), abs(z1-z2)].
        Parameters:
        p1 - the other point
        Returns:
        the L-infinite distance
